name: Critters! Critters! Critters! Quiz | Miscellaneous Animal Trivia | 10 Questions

questions.text: What animal has upside-down hair full of moths and algae?
questions.explanation:
sloth.

	The caterpillars of the moths feed on the algae, which grow in grooves on the hair.

questions.text: Where in its mother does a Surinam toad pass through its tadpole stage?
options: they don't go through a tadpole stage
questions.explanation:
back.

	The male places the eggs in her spongy skin, where they develop into adult toads.

questions.text: What do the large ears on desert animals help them do?
questions.explanation:
keep cool.

	Blood flows through the ears and causes heat to escape.

questions.text: What kind of animal is the blue-footed booby?
questions.explanation:
bird.

	Sailors named this seabird bobo, or 'booby,' because it landed on ships and let itself be caught.

questions.text: One kind of mole has a ring of pink 'fingers' on his nose. What is its name?
questions.explanation:
star-nose mole.

	The 'fingers' are fleshy feelers that wave around in search of food.

questions.text: Which of the following animals does NOT mate for life?
The male emperor penguin doesn't eat for two months while he holds what small object on his foot?
questions.explanation:
egg & an egg.

	It is kept warm in a fold of his skin until it's ready to hatch.

questions.text: All centipedes have at least 100 legs. True or False?
questions.explanation:
False.

	Centipedes have two legs per segment, but some only have 14 segments.

questions.text: If you could touch a shark's skin, which of the following things would it feel like?
questions.explanation:
sandpaper.

	Brushing up against a shark in the water can be painful!

questions.text: Which of the following sea animals digests its food outside its body?
questions.explanation:
starfish.

	It pushes its stomach out through its mouth to surround and digest its prey.
